meaningMnemonic:
The <kanji>neck</kanji> of the <kanji>squad</kanji> is the most important part of the squad, for if you lose the neck you lose the head (they're all one thing). This person is the <vocabulary>head</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>leader</vocabulary> of a group.

This is a very formal word to refer to someone in a top role, especially a <vocabulary>Prime Minister</vocabulary> (aka the head of the cabinet).
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word so it uses the on'yomi readings. You learned the on'yomi for 首 in the words 部首 and 首位, and you learned the on'yomi for 班 with the kanji. Go you!
